walkthroughs.title: View the Context for a piece of code
walkthroughs.description: Learn how to use watermelon to find all the context of your code

steps.title: View Context with a Right Click
steps.description: Select a piece of code and use your mouse's right click to launch Watermelon.

steps.title: View Context with a Command
steps.description: Select a piece of code and view the Context from the keyboard with the Command Palette. Use the shortcut Ctrl+Shift+P (Cmd+Shift+P on Mac) to open the Command Palette. Type 'Watermelon' and select 'Watermelon:Get Code Context'.

steps.title: View Context with the Watermelon Sidebar
steps.description: Select a piece of code and view the context from the Watermelon Sidebar.

steps.title: View Context with the Watermelon Hover Panel
steps.description: Select a piece of code and view the context from the Watermelon Panel.

steps.title: View Context with a Keyboard Shortcut
steps.description: Select a piece of code and view the context from the keyboard with `Ctrl+Shift+C`.

steps.title: View Context with a Keyboard Shortcut
steps.description: Select a piece of code and view the context from the keyboard with `Ctrl+Shift+C`.

steps.title: View Commit context with a Keyboard Shortcut
steps.description: Select a piece of code and view the context from the keyboard with `Cmd+Shift+C`.

walkthroughs.title: View the Context for a line of code
walkthroughs.description: Understand what you see when you hover code with the Watermelon Hover Panel

steps.description: Hover over code and view information on it.

steps.description: Wait a few seconds and more services will be added to the panel.
